page.title: 14L. History in Stallingboro'
page.content: Ayscough Ave Council House Estate and Askew House group dwelling are named after Ann Ayscough of Stallingborough the last women to be burnt as a heretic in England at Smithfield in 1546. Carr Lane derives its name from "carr" meaning a marsh. Town Gate Lodge (a modern bungalow) is named after the gate which used to stand at the eastern end of the village, beyond which was a cart track to the marsh. There are several houses in the village dating from early 19th century and before.
